author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal v Bayern Munich: Real Madrid, AC Milan and Gunners' best Champions League results | Metro News
text:
Arsenal’s best five Champions League results as they eye unlikely win at Bayern Munich opinion Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 12:00 pm Arsenal do occasionally get it right in Europe (Pictures: Getty) 
This Valentine’s Day Arsenal are preparing to be reunited with one of Arsene Wenger ‘s great unrequited loves – the Champions League. The Gunners and European football have for some reason not been a match made in Heaven down the years, and it looks like there could be more heartbreak this time as well. 
But since today is the day of romance, we’re getting a bit misty-eyed about those rare nights in Europe when Arsenal have really shown what they’re made of with some breathtaking victories against the very best sides on the continent. Barcelona stars in stitches after Neymar turns up to training with new look 
It does happen occasionally, and maybe they’re overdue one after six seasons in a row of getting dumped out at this stage of the competition. Even if just due to the sheer law of averages, Arsenal must have some small hope, right? 
No one gave them much of a chance in these five games either, so here’s a look back at some Champions League classics for Arsenal fans to give them some belief that they can fall back in love with their team all over again… Inter Milan 1-5 Arsenal (2003) Thierry Henry was on fire in a 5-1 Arsenal win at Inter Milan (Picture: Getty) 
What a night for Arsenal. In need of a victory to keep any hope of qualifying from their group alive, the Gunners faced the daunting task of a trip to Inter Milan, who’d beaten them 3-0 at Highbury just weeks earlier. 
Still, seeming to thrive most when written off, the Gunners produced one of their greatest Champions League performances to thrash the Italian giants 5-1. 
Thierry Henry (who else?) struck two fine goals, while Freddie Ljungberg, Edu and Robert Pires helped themselves to the three others. 
It should’ve been the start of something bigger for that group of players in this tournament, but it wasn’t, as despite their fine Premier League form in that Invincibles year, they under-achieved in Europe with a defeat to Chelsea in the quarter-finals.
